data.name: Apex Construct
data.description:
ENHANCED FOR META QUEST 3!

Apex Construct is a single player VR action/adventure. Wield an upgradable bow & shield combination to battle enemy robots while exploring and solving mysteries in a shattered world.

EXPLORE A WORLD RIPPED APART
Step into a beautiful yet perilous post-apocalyptic setting, where two powerful AIs are locked in a drawn-out conflict. As the only living human, you will uncover its many secret areas and solve intriguing puzzles

MASTER A FLUID BOW & SHIELD COMBINATION
Use a flexible weapons system with unparalleled precision to engage a wide array of artificial lifeforms created by a mysterious entity called Mothr

DELVE INTO A LASTING EXPERIENCE
Replay any mission from your customizable home base to uncover paths still hidden & spend acquired resources to upgrade your weapons and equipment

CONQUER THE “CYGNIA CUP CHALLENGE”
Hit the targets, keep the combo meter up and maximize your score in the pre-apocalyptic arena to dominate the global leaderboards

changelog.change_log:
Engine update
Performance improvements
Bug fixes
Visual improvements

Improved force grab. It's now much easier force grabbing items in general and the one you aim at in particular.
Improved controller haptics. You now get haptic feedback when opening/closing doors and drawers or riding elevators.
Improved intro flow. Less background popping. Sharper graphics.
Fixed so hands or bow gets hidden when bringing up the System Menu.

Upgraded to Unity 2020
Switched to 64-bit builds
Upgraded Oculus Integration to v35
Misc code bug fixes
Performance improvements to allow for 4xMSAA and no FFR on Quest2 (more crisp image)
Tweaked arrows to become visible closer to the bow to lower the risk of accidently push stuff
Subtitles now render using OVR overlays (more crisp)
Made the game Focus Aware and pause when system menu is brought up
Improved controller haptic feedback
Upgraded bHaptics SDK to get it working again
New splash screen and animated logo at start
Improved throwing experience in general and canister grenades in particular
Disabled the 180 flip by default (can be toggled from any CygDOS terminal using the "flip" command)

Crash fix: Fixed a Unity Physics crash by reverting back to 32-bit builds.
Bug Fix: Fixed an issue where levers would get stuck if released before fully pulled.
Quest 2 enhancements: Enabled ragdolls, more particle effects and more audio effects. Disabled foveated rendering.
Apex Construct is now a 64-bit game!

Improved interactions. Picking up and interacting with items should now be a more stable experience. I.e. there is less risk for items to get stuck or jitter when picking them up. Interactions also got a visual improvement as the player's hand stick to the item being picked up.
Apex build #24. Hot fix for the rare occasion where save game could be trashed when exiting the game
